definition: A dish of meat and vegetables cooked slowly in liquid in a closed dish or pan.
examples: lamb stew
beef stewed in wine
stew in one's own juice

definition: (of a bird) strike or bite something with its beak
examples: two geese were pecking at some grain

definition: Drink or eat (something) with a loud sucking noise.
examples: she slurped her coffee

definition: (of an animal such as a dog) make an aggressive growl with bared teeth.
(something up) Entangle something
A knot or tangle
examples: the dog snarled at the boy
the trailing lead got snarled up in a bramble bush
snarls of wild raspberry plants

definition: Twist together into a confused mass.
Become involved in a conflict or fight with
examples: the broom somehow got tangled up in my long skirt
they usually come a cropper when they tangle with the heavy mobs

definition: Jab or prod (someone or something) with one's finger or a sharp object.
Thrust (something, such as one's head) in a particular direction.
examples: they sniffed, felt, and poked at everything they bought
I poked my head around the door to see what was going on
his mother comes into his room sometimes and has a poke round

definition: A fixed regular payment earned for work or services, typically paid on a daily or weekly basis [Compare with salary]
Carry on (a war or campaign)
examples: we were struggling to get better wages
it is necessary to destroy their capacity to wage war

definition: Work extremely hard or incessantly.
[with adverbial of direction] Move slowly and with difficulty.
Exhausting physical labour.
examples: Richard toiled to build his editorial team
she began to toil up the cliff path

definition: Work, especially physical work.
Workers, especially manual workers, considered collectively.
Work hard; make great effort.
examples: they laboured from dawn to dusk
a labour of Hercules

definition: An implement consisting of a bundle of thick loose strings or a sponge attached to a handle, used for wiping floors or other surfaces.
An act of wiping something clean.
A thick mass of disordered hair.
Clean or soak up liquid from (something) by wiping.
examples: the kitchen needed a quick mop
she mopped the floor and cleaned out two cupboards

definition: Lose one's footing and slide unintentionally for a short distance.
Accidentally slide or move out of position or from someone's grasp.
Go or move quietly or quickly, without attracting notice.
Pass or change to a lower, worse, or different condition, typically in a gradual or imperceptible way.
examples: I slipped over on the ice
the envelope slipped through Luke's fingers
we slipped out by a back door
many people feel standards have slipped
